comments.commentBody: This is an excellent summary of how SAC has achieved the "extraordinary returns" that allowed it to beat the competition.  "Criminal genius" is an excellent way to describe it.

Let me get this right:

1 - Cohen sets up his hedge fund with "unorthodox structure" of 140 decentralized teams/traders

2 - Cohen pays "mammoth compensation" to ambitious traders for "insights" which created "some of the best returns in the business" (SEC alert - like Bernie Madoff's always-sunny returns?)

3 - Cohen's teams/traders are "all required to share their best investment ideas with Mr. Cohen, who historically has managed the largest account, worth several billion" -- enabling Cohen to leverage the "insights" of his organization

4 - Cohen's traders have pled guilty to insider trading, explaining the nature of the "insights" they passed to Cohen, thus

5 - How is Cohen NOT the sponsor, beneficiary and equally guilty of his traders' insider trading?

This is a simple "funnel" operation for defrauding the markets that the SEC exists to protect. The SEC lawsuit accusing Cohen of "turning a blind eye to misconduct at his fund" is timid, foolish, and degrades the criminal genius of Mr. Cohen.

I look forward to the next Presidential election, when the parties will be whipping their voters into a frenzy, each preaching a message of promise and how America is still the greatest country on earth.  And then I'll remember back to the financial crisis, and I'll recall images of Steven A. Cohen at the Knicks game instead of in jail, and I'll know the whole thing is just nonsense.
Awesome! Best comment today!

No, Martha Stewart did not go to jail for " a single insider trading transaction." She went to jail for lying to the FBI. She was not convicted of insider trading.

The fact that an uninformed post like this garners 159 "recommends" does not speak well of the participants on this comments board.

* Americans are fed up with corporations agreeing to pay fines -- sometimes big fines -- and then avoiding jail while some impoverished young girl in the Midwest gets sentenced to 10- to 15-years in a federal prison for doing Meth.

* Folks, read the late Harvard criminal law professor William J. Stuntz: "The Collapse of American Criminal Justice."

* We have a mind boggling number of American citizens in prison. Often for-profit prisons. Don't call them inmates. Call them customers.

* While the big fat cats line their pockets, fleece average Americans and, when caught, pay a fine (the cost of doing business) and "admit no wrongdoing."

* What's wrong with this picture?
That is like a drug dealer getting a fine but getting to keep 90 % of the profits. Typical American justice for wall st
Big deal ask forgiveness instead  of permission . He still keeps 8 billion with a B.

@ Mr. Daniel Loeb

Seems like a lot of your value plays lately (Sony, Nokia) are divestitures, acquisitions, spinoffs or the push for those.

Is this an accelerating trend for the future, the breaking up (selloff) of business units that underscore the operating profit of their parent [holdings] ?
White collar criminals/ investment bankers do not go to jail in the USA. The trick is to steal enough money to hire some good lawyers and make lots of large political contributions.  Lol.
How would you like that, cash or check?

"Corporations are people, my friend", a "founding principle" of the nation, as the GOP standard bearer "the Mitt" so proudly proclaimed just last year.

People who do insider trading, at least some times, do go to jail: even the immortal fashion queen Martha Stewart did not escape that. Since SAC pleaded guilty, shouldn't SAD go to jail too? There are at least two ways to do that.

One is to lock up their office door, put a GPS on the lock, hopfully with the corporate officers in it. Another is to haul the current crop of corporate officers to jail. That is only fair isn't it?

People who rob a Seve Eleven store because they are hungry go to jail and that is only a minor crime, assuming nobody is injured or killed. Those who do insider trading are hacking at the foundation of our economic system and is a much more serious crime. Shouldn't they go to jail too?

The law forbids all men from begging, stealing bread, and sleeping in the streets. The rich as well as the poor.

Sorry, I forgot who wrote this. The point is, who makes the laws ? Those wall street executives, the best and brightest, drove their companies into insolvency. They ended up still getting their massive "bonuses", and getting the value of their (worthless) stock propped up, courtesy of the taxpayers.

Lying, cheating, gambling in an unproductive business by moving numbers on the screen....and still in denial about crimes commited. Well you heard the man, he said he's innocent and so here we go. Welcome to the US (EU for that matter, capitalist) justice system, laws of impunity for the rich and criminal ones for the rest. Truly tragic...SAC is a joke, US government is a joke...
Right in the middle of the bullseye.

So, ANY Republican likely to run for the Presidency would be better? Wall Street, in case you haven't noticed, and corporations are by default and Adam Smith the territory of the GOP. The GOP is all over the Keystone Pipeline; they wouldn't care if it ran through your momma's living room. I can't imagine any GOP President wouldn't uses drones if it would protect American lives, and torture is not exclusive to any political party or President, never has been, never will be, no matter what they say, because it's basically a "what I don't know won't hurt me, so I don't want to know" proposition for most politicians.

You're going to have to look long and hard to find a candidate that meets your specifications, I'll tell you that! Rather than knocking Hillary and Obama, why not provide an example of who you have in mind.
but better by far than a 'publican.

Obama has already given us a Democrat who is soft on Wall Street, and willing to use drones and torture. Soon he may sign off on the Keystone pipeline and provide a death knell for the planet.

Hillary would be more of the same. No thanks.
She was correct in that it is not an assault weapon, as assault weapons are not legal for sale in California.
And why did whites flee?

Your last paragraph is 100% wrong JustForFun..

Blacks love their guns just like whites, otherwise we would not have so many black on black killings in minority areas.

It is a national sickness. It knows no racial barriers....

In the Ghetto, the gun is the national symbol of youth, not the flag.

Hollywood put it there...

Lump all the rural whites together, then read their minds.
Nice trick.

the overwhelming % of affluent americans are white. when they moved out of the cities into exurbia in 60s/70s, they took alot of the tax base with them. lower tax base means decreased public services and no infrastructure maintenance, which means even more flight, which leaves large population of poor, uneducated, underemployed mostly minorities in many urban areas.

to make matters worse, the police unions in many of these areas continued to be dominated by white immigrant groups (Irish, Italian). this tends to set up an us-versus-them situation in many of these areas, the results being poor response times and general mistrust between police and population.

when you feel that you can't rely on the police for protection, you do whatever you have to---which is very often to arm yourself. anecdotal evidence suggests that urban blacks as a class would very, very much love to wish away ALL guns, so they wouldn't feel the need to arm themselves. it is interesting to meditate on the cultural difference between this situation and rural/small town whites, who also tend to carry guns alot, but who anecdotal evidence suggests would miss their guns even if all need for them vanished.

blacks hate their guns, rural whites cherish them. i don't know what it all means. but it is no wonder that we have such a yawning gulf between the two political sides of the gun control issue.

Not very many in this world have an imaginative, desperate need for art,
especially the 1%. To buy this work just to own it is somewhat kin to what Hitler did while he tried to figure out whether it was decadent and should be
destroyed. His under generals tended to see the value, not necessarily aesthetic.

You are a genius with numbers, sir!

The US Robbery rate is 116.3 per 100,000 persons.

Canada? 79 per 100,000 persons.

Looks like you are far, far less to be robbed in Canada than in the US, despite the robber being much more likely to rob someone who is armed here in the states!

Odd how that works out, eh?

9000 euros is about $12,000 so it is disturbing that this amount of money would bring attention from the authorities. That said, this is hardly nothing and most families of 4 do not live on anything like $12,000 a month.

Where did you come up with the notion that the average family of four in Europe lives on a budget of over a hundred thousand euros? The real average, in Germany for instance, is about a third of that. Even that is high compared to the U.S. when you account for exchange rates.

But what do you do when Democrats say things that are not true. That are verifiably, arithmetically false?

Examples:

We need to increase education spending to benefit education outcomes

According to the Department of Education, in constant dollars, in 1980 we spent $5773 per pupil on education. In 2009 that figure was $10, 694. So in real dollars we have nearly doubled spending.

http://nces.ed.gov/fastfacts/display.asp?id=66

According to the NAEP, the "Nation's Report Card", for roughly the same time period, there has been virtually no discernible change in reading and mathematics scores.

http://nces.ed.gov/pubsearch/pubsinfo.asp?pubid=2005464
7. Constitutional amendment to repeal corporate personhood for the purposes of voting (repeals Citizens United decision.)

If you are forced to sell your collection for a pittance to avoid ending up in a concentration camp and dead, and German Jews were incarcerated in such camps well before the beginning of World War 2, then it can hardly be claimed that this was a fair business venture. In this manner German Jews were forced to sell businesses and property. The prices were absurd; it was no more than thievery and things were not usually much better when a non-Jewish "partner" bought out the business.
So I would say that a good deal of these "sales" (??) should be cancelled (they were never sales) and a mechanism should be found to compensate survivors.
And what in the world makes this revisonism?

So what are the rules here? If a Jewish family in the 1930s sold art at a depressed price in order to leave Germany are these sales now cancelled? Do the buyers get their money back? How does this revisionism work after so much time has passed?

Mac K, You getta reco from moi for admitting you're a maroon! Hahahahaha

Howie

Michael Berndtson, Nov. 3rd post

Dear Mr. Berndtson,

I use a polite and somewhat formal mode of address ("Dear Mr or Ms ...") to set a civil tone for dialogue.

My experience is that addressing potential correspondents with "Hey, Fool!" or "Listen up, half-wit!" makes for shrill and vehement exchanges which are not well thought out or productive.

And I speak for no one but myself.

If the GCM models are using a slab model of the ocean then there is no mystery why their predictive performance is so poor. Vigorous ocean mixing has a profound effect on both heat transfer and CO2 sequestration.

Carbon tax? No point. The deep ocean's heat capacity is the system's dash pot, the shock absorber, that smooths out surface thermal fluctuations. And the essentially infinite buffering capacity of ocean water will limit pH shift to levels the sea creatures can tolerate.

As for your little riff on Reince and the slave auction, Reince Priebus is a Yankee lawyer. His party is not the one who used the KKK as its terrorist wing from the 1880's to the 1970's. His party is not the one which seceded from the union to keep its slave auctions.

His party is the one founded to STOP slave auctions, of the 13th, 14th and 15th amendments, of Brown vs B. of Education, of Eisenhower sending in the 101st and Everett Dirksen helping Johnson pass the Civil Rights Law over the hysterical opposition of southern senators in the president's own party.

Is that the Reince you were referring to?

Just as there are Germans, Dutch, French, Italians, et al who continue to live well in apartments & houses confiscated from Jews killed or forced to flee.  And most are well aware of the provenance of their property.  Hence, the silence.
Probably true - just like there are many Americans today that are living on land that once belonged to Native Americans that were either killed or driven off.
Certainly true, but why are Austrians always left unscathed?  They were disproportionately involved in all this.

The Nazis were almost as much about stealing from Jews as they were about killing them. There is no doubt in my mind that some Germans today are still eating off of dinner plates that once belonged to Jews.
